pull.title: net: Use serialization parameters for CAddress serialization
pull.body:
It seems confusing that picking a wrong value for `ADDRV2_FORMAT` could have effects on consensus. (See the docstring of `ADDRV2_FORMAT`).

Fix this by implementing https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/19477#issuecomment-1147421608 .

### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#27918](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27918) (fuzz: addrman, avoid `ConsumeDeserializable` when possible by brunoerg)
* [#27509](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27509) (Relay own transactions only via short-lived Tor or I2P connections by vasild)
* [#26859](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26859) (fuzz: extend ConsumeNetAddr() to return I2P and CJDNS addresses by vasild)
* [#26621](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26621) (refactor: Continue moving application data from CNode to Peer by dergoegge)
* [#24034](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/24034) (p2p: delete anchors.dat after trying to connect to that peers by brunoerg)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

>It seems confusing to have consensus (weakly) depend on low level BIP 155 addrv2 serialization.

You mean the "consensus" module, right, not actual consensus?

events.message: Replace READWRITEAS macro with AsBase wrapping function

Rename CSerAction* to Action*

This allows new code, added in the next commit, to conform to the coding
guideline: No C-prefix for class names.

Support for serialization parameters

(Modified by Marco Falke)

The moved part can be reviewed with the git options
 --ignore-all-space --color-moved=dimmed-zebra --color-moved-ws=ignore-all-space
